page.title: 16Lt.Kingshill Baptist Church
page.content: In 1814,February 17th,the church was formed.It consisted of the chapel,a cottage,out buildings,a stable,the burial ground and a garden. Fourteen years later Mr.Thomas Jordan,the pastor,died.Six years later the chapel was pulled down and was rebuilt.It was much larger than before,altogether it cost Â£140 to be rebuilt. In 1840 two new galleries were built.Fifteen years later some new trustees were appointed.Until 53 years ago the church was lit by oil lamps, but in 1932 electric lights were installed. In 1933 the people who ran it started a childrens weekday service. Today the hall,which is joined to the church,is being extended to make it bigger because the church community is growing and so more space is required for church activities.
